history.content:
I’ve been interning (part time, 20hr/wk) during the school year for the last three years, and most likely will again this year. It’s a carryover of my summer internship, extended through the school year. Most semester internships will ask for 40 hour weeks, so they’re difficult to do with academics. I would try to find a research position, and then a summer internship that will let you work during the school year. 

 
Fair warning, working during the school year can be pretty brutal, and having a manager that’s great about flexible hours is pretty much a must. I also highly recommend taking the minimum number of courses. It’s completely doable, but it’s a lot. 
--------------------------------------------------------------------
I interned the fall semester last year and would not do it again. It's highly dependent on your situation and the work you do during your internship. If your work involves an "intern" project or something that is not core to a product or the company it is probably very doable. I was working on stuff that ended up being core to one of the company's major products, so when bugs arose I needed to address them ASAP. This could put undo stress on me at the most inopportune times (midterm season). It really prevented me from putting in enough time to my classes / extracurriculars / social life that was more important to me. Like I said, highly dependent on the company you work for though. As long as you aren't working on mission critical things under a deadline it is probably very doable. I would also recommend working under a fixed schedule rather than a flexible one, as a flexible one inevitably results in the company asking you to do more work than you feel you can at certain times.

I’ve been interning (part time, 20hr/wk) during the school year for the last three years, and most likely will again this year. It’s a carryover of my summer internship, extended through the school year. Most semester internships will ask for 40 hour weeks, so they’re difficult to do with academics. I would try to find a research position, and then a summer internship that will let you work during the school year. 

Fair warning, working during the school year can be pretty brutal, and having a manager that’s great about flexible hours is pretty much a must. I also highly recommend taking the minimum number of courses. It’s completely doable, but it’s a lot.

Hi, I was wondering if anyone has been doing internship during semester? Are there any good resources to find position posts and is it better to do internship while taking class or just focus on academics first and maybe find a research opportunity? By next semester I will have done 61A/B/C, CS70, EE16B, Math 53/54. Have some experience over machine learning (not much but I know basic ideas and have done some implementations), will take 189 next semester.
history.subject: In-semester internship
